meanings.definition: Below the level that inhibits growth or activity.
meanings.sent1: The subinhibitory dose of the medication did not completely stop the bacteria from growing.
meanings.sent2: The subinhibitory effect of the chemical slowed down the spread of the virus.
meanings.sent3: The subinhibitory treatment made the bacteria dance slowly instead of stopping them completely.
meanings.sent4: Her subinhibitory presence in the room was like a gentle breeze, not overpowering but noticeable.
meanings.sent5: The subinhibitory nature of the music created a calming atmosphere in the laboratory.

meanings.definition: Acting to prevent or slow down growth or activity, but not completely stopping it.
meanings.sent1: The subinhibitory substance helped control the growth of the plants without halting it entirely.
meanings.sent2: The subinhibitory treatment allowed the cells to continue functioning at a reduced rate.
meanings.sent3: The subinhibitory solution played a trick on the bacteria, making them move in slow motion.
meanings.sent4: His subinhibitory influence on the team was like a gentle nudge, not forceful but effective.
meanings.sent5: The subinhibitory impact of the weather made the outdoor activities more leisurely.
